page.title: 07Honiton Fair
page.content: Honiton fair goes back to the 13C. It is held on the first Wednesday and Thursday after July 19th. On the Tuesday before the fair the Town Crier Joe Lake proceeds along the High Street with the Mayor. He carries a pole wreathed in flowers with a gilded glove on top, and shouts 'Ye fair is begun. Ye glove is up. No man shall be arrested until ye glove is taken down. God save the Queen.' Hot coins are thrown from traditional sites in the High Street where children scramble for them. Finally the glove is hoisted outside the White Lion public house for the duration of the fair. This year pennies were thrown by the landlords and by Freeman Bill Tucker and the Town Mayor Bill Cogger.
